required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study Comparing Arzoxifene With Raloxifene in Women After Menopause With Osteoporosis
clinical_study.official_title: The Comparison of the Efficacy and Safety of Arzoxifene Versus Raloxifene in Postmenopausal Women With Osteoporosis

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to compare the effect of arzoxifene to raloxifene on the bone mineral density (bone strength).

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Percent change in Lumbar Spine BMD

secondary_outcome.measure: Secondary BMD measures of total hip and femoral neck
Biochemical markers of bone metabolism assessed

intervention.description: 20 mg, oral, tablet, once a day for 52 weeks
60 mg, oral, tablet, once a day for 52 weeks

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Must have osteoporosis
- Must be between 50 and 75 years old and be able to walk
- Have at least two of your back bones that can be x-rayed
- Have not had a period in at least two years
- Be willing to have blood tests
Exclusion Criteria:
- Have a bone disease other than osteoporosis
- History of estrogen dependent cancer
- History of stroke or certain heart problems
- Possibly have an allergy to raloxifene or arzoxifene
- Have certain abnormal lab values
- History of seizure disorder
- Have unexplained vaginal bleeding or an abnormal pap smear
